contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|ate=November 2011|date=November 2011}} {{Infobox person | name =John Randolph Hearst | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = September 26, 1909 | birth_place = | death_date = 1958 | death_place = Virgin Islands | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | residence = | nationality = | other_names = | known_for = | education = | employer =[[Hearst Corporation]] | occupation = | title = | salary = | networth = | height = | weight = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | boards = | religion = | spouse = | partner = | children = [[John Randolph Hearst, Jr.]], [[William Randolph Hearst II]] | parents =[[William Randolph Hearst]], [[Millicent Hearst]] | relatives = | footnotes = }} '''John Randolph Hearst''' (1909–1958) was an American business executive and the third son of [[William Randolph Hearst]]. He married Gretchen Wilson, who later married Woolworth Donahue (Jesse (Woolworth) Donahue's son). He was said by some to have the most executive talent among the sons of William Randolph Hearst, and like his brothers worked for the [[Hearst Corporation]]. Any question of his rivaling the non-family executives who constituted a majority of the trustees of his father's will, however, was rendered moot by his untimely death.
